channel.title: Formula One
channel.description:
Im suprised that there is no thread about it even though only eurofags like it.
[b]Whats your opinion on this season?[/b] I Personally think that the competition is totally ruined this year since drivers (Jenson Button) that would only dream of podium are winning 4 out of 5 races. The world Champion, Lewis Hamilton is currently 7th. Additionally, Robert Kubica, who was a good contender last season, has not even got a point. Finally its amazing to see how the "new" team is dominating the sport while Ferrari and McLaren, who have always been good are doing terrible.
Its all crazy imo.

item.title: Formula One
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

If you want to truley compare F1 drivers without the different car nonsense look no further than the Top Gear F1 leaderboard.

  1. 1:44.4 – The Stig (II)
  2. 1:44.6 – Nigel Mansell
  3. 1:44.7 – Jenson Button
  4. 1:44.7 - Lewis Hamilton (Wet & Oily)
  5. 1:46.0 – The Stig (I)
  6. 1:46.3 – Damon Hill
  7. 1:47.1 – Mark Webber (Very wet)
  8. 1:48.0 – The Stig (I)

Theoretically then, Hamiltion is a better driver than Button. So why is he having such a terrible season?

Read full topic

item.title: Formula One
item.dc:creator: @Man_UTD_Freak Man UTD Freak
item.description:
@Man_UTD_Freak wrote:

Greeny:

The Honda car was terrible though, he’s not a bad driver at all don’t be an idiot.

Good drivers make bad cars look good. But you have to look at the stats! I mean 51 points in how many races with his new team? And only 3 points in the whole season last year. Fair enough, it was quite a terrible car but you have to expect more points than that if he’s supposed to be a good driver.

Read full topic

item.title: Formula One
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

He is a brilliant driver, its all the other drivers that are shitty, thats why they’re doing so poor this year because the Traction Control was taken away and replaced with Slick tyres, so the drivers acctually have to try and drive.

Read full topic

item.title: Formula One

item.description:
@Man_UTD_Freak wrote:

Bloody J.Button is ruining the competition after his Monaco grand prix win and it’s obviously not his driving skill but the car. I mean look at last year when he was with Honda. 3 points after the whole season!

http://www.formula1.com/results/driver/2008/

Read full topic

item.title: Formula One
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:18, topic:279945”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=369414.msg2796986#msg2796986 date=1243120188]
Next year is seriously going to suck dick if the £40m budget rule is placed, because all the tops teams, Renault, Ferrari, Mclaren, etc. They are all leaving.

But Brawn GP is doing so good because of their expertise, Ross Brawn was at Ferrari for many many years and they had the top drivers for most of that, but also because the other top teams, Mclaren, Ferrari, Renault, they all relied on electronics for their races, Renault had their launch control and every team had Traction Control, which has been removed and Slick tyres came back, thus showing the drivers with the true skill.
[/quote]

Putting a limit on the budget is a good thing. The teams will have to gamble a bit on what’s the best improvement, which in turn is good for competition. I mean, how can a team with a budget of 80m win of a team with a budget of 200m?[/quote]

But the teams that were using £200m+ per year are going to struggle to keep up with the pace, because they will ave to stretch their money further.

Read full topic

[quote=“eczema3, post:10, topic:279945”]Next year is seriously going to suck dick if the £40m budget rule is placed, because all the tops teams, Renault, Ferrari, Mclaren, etc. They are all leaving.

But Brawn GP is doing so good because of their expertise, Ross Brawn was at Ferrari for many many years and they had the top drivers for most of that, but also because the other top teams, Mclaren, Ferrari, Renault, they all relied on electronics for their races, Renault had their launch control and every team had Traction Control, which has been removed and Slick tyres came back, thus showing the drivers with the true skill.[/quote]

Putting a limit on the budget is a good thing. The teams will have to gamble a bit on what’s the best improvement, which in turn is good for competition. I mean, how can a team with a budget of €80m win of a team with a budget of €200m?

Read full topic

On an additional note: Congratulations on winning the Monaco Grand Prix

But admittedly, the most boring Monaco GP I’ve EVER seen.

But Brawn GP is doing so good because of their expertise, Ross Brawn was at Ferrari for many many years and they had the top drivers for most of that, but also because the other top teams, Mclaren, Ferrari, Renault, they all relied on electronics for their races, Renault had their launch control and every team had Traction Control, which has been removed and Slick tyres came back, thus showing the drivers with the true skill.

item.title: Formula One
item.dc:creator: @Man_UTD_Freak Man UTD Freak
item.description:
@Man_UTD_Freak wrote:

sanga282:

WRC > F1

No…

Probably the biggest surprise to me is how well Sebastien Vettel and Mark Webber are doing for RBR Renault. So too Brawn GP’s sudden domination of the sport.

They’ll be tested in Monaco. I’ve heard J.Button, K.Raikkonen! and R.Barrichello were the top 3 in Qualifying. Massa’s at 5.

What the funniest thing is is that Force India are yet to score a point in either the Drivers or Constructors championship during their time in the sport which is what, almost 1 and a half years?

Read full topic
